content: I'd like to announce that Sunday Q4 in Baltimore will be a tutorial for using the new IG publisher

btw: are you happy that I get Mary-Anne to sent the following email out to all connectathon registrants:

Dear colleague,

Thanks for registering to attend the connectathon in Baltimore this year. We value your input and trust that you find the event both educational and fun!

As you probably know, the event is organized into a number of tracks, and you are welcome to participate in as many tracks as you have capacity for (though it's always best to have one as a focus). To help us with organizing the event on the day (and in particular the seating), we'd very much appreciate it if you could indicate on the spreadsheet below which tracks you will be participating in, and in which roles. It would also help if you could indicate your primary track, as we'll use that when we assign tracks to tables...

If you have any questions abut a track, then it is best to contact the track co-ordinator - all the track proposals are documented here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Category:201609_FHIR_Connectathon_Track_Proposals

If it's about the event in general, then I can be reached at david.hay25@gmail.com

Spreadsheet link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rrz8yqkG5gHhSEzUvZxP-6_CCFr_6F0FUElFRGmObyw/edit#gid=0

Again, thank you for coming and we look forward to meeting you on the day,
(I may not be at the meeting tomorrow to discuss in person)
Thanks @David Hay ! I'm still concerned about the usability of the spreadsheet (I can't quite understand it myself, or I'd propose a more specific fix.
OK - I'll take another look at it - maybe some help text or a re-work? It hasn't changed from Montreal (other than the tracks)...
